Hope your day is going well!!

I'm excited to share that Cedric, Felix and JS are scheduled to be in town
next week!  With this, please make the necessary plans to report to the
below address on *Monday, September 11th at 1PM*, sharp.  The idea is to
take advantage that our executive leaders are local and spend time together
learning sales techniques and sharing best practices.

next week until their departure on Thursday evening. Therefore, please plan

around 6PM, with an hour lunch.

opportunity to receive valuable training & coaching as we go through
different strategies to gain clients.

subject: In Town: Our Executive Leadership Team
body:
Hi Viviana & Santiago,

Hope your day is going well!!

I'm excited to share that Cedric, Felix and JS are scheduled to be in town
next week!  With this, please make the necessary plans to report to the
below address on *Monday, September 11th at 1PM*, sharp.  The idea is to
take advantage that our executive leaders are local and spend time together
learning sales techniques and sharing best practices.

With this, the expectation is that we report to the below address every day
next week until their departure on Thursday evening. Therefore, please plan
to report to work on *Tuesday thru Thursday at 9AM*; we would conclude at
around 6PM, with an hour lunch.

I'm super excited to work side-by-side with you all; and us having the
opportunity to receive valuable training & coaching as we go through
different strategies to gain clients.

Looking forward to an amazing and productive week, next week!

*ADDRESS:*
1511 SE 12th Court
Deerfield Beach, FL  33441

Enjoy your weekend and see you then!
Maria

*Maria F. Perez-Marom*

Head of HR Consulting & Outsourcing Services

HRSupport - USA

www.hrsupportusa.com

maria@hrsupportusa.com

subject: Fwd: Offre d'emploi retir√© et autres...
body:
Envoy√© √† partir de Outlook pour iOS<https://aka.ms/o0ukef>
________________________________
De : Claudia Drozdoski <claudia@rhsupport.ca>
Envoy√© : mardi, ao√ªt 15, 2023 3:23 p.m.
√Ä : felix hamel <felixhamel1991@gmail.com>
Objet : Offre d'emploi retir√© et autres...

Bonjour F√©lix

J'ai communiqu√© avec les 2 candidates - j'ai t√©l√©phon√© a Nancy et laiss√© un message sur sa boite vocale et lui ai √©crit un texto. Elle m'a √©crit me disant qu'elle pourrait descendre de salaire en attendant et faire moins d'heure et combiner son ancienne job et RH Support.
Je vais lui t√©l√©phoner demain et voir ce qui est possible. Elle me dit qu'elle pourrait faire 10 ou 15 heures par semaine...

Pour Martine, je n'ai pas son num√©ro de tel√©phone. Je lui ai √©crit un courriel avec les d√©tails et vais lui t√©l√©phoner demain,

Pour notre information, j'ai recherch√© quel pourrait l√©galement √™tre un impact de retirer des offres et si il y a une poursuite, a quoi pourrait on s'exposer. Voir texte de  jurisprudence que j'ai trouv√© chez Fasken (un cabinet d'avocat). Un retrait de l'offre a oblig√© l'employeur √† payer 3 mois de salaire au candidat en dommages moraux. Pour cela, il faut une plainte et je ne crois pas que Nancy va porter plainte. Je suis moins certaine pour Martine mais on ne sait jamais...



Les faits

L'employ√© a √©t√© recrut√© par un nouvel employeur avec la promesse d'un salaire beaucoup plus √©lev√©. Il a sign√© une offre √©crite et a remis un pr√©avis √† son ancien employeur. Moins d'une semaine avant sa date d'entr√©e en fonctions, le nouvel employeur lui a annonc√© que son offre d'emploi √©tait retir√©e sans explication ni indemnisation. Son ancien poste √©tant d√©j√† pourvu, il a √©t√© sans emploi pendant presque dix semaines avant de trouver un nouvel emploi.

L'employ√© a intent√© une poursuite. En l'absence de r√©ponse de l'employeur, le tribunal a √©t√© appel√© √† d√©cider de la somme qu'il devrait payer. Le nouvel employeur ne s'est pas pr√©sent√© √† l'audience.

La d√©cision

La juge a accept√© tous les faits √©nonc√©s par l'employ√©, car le nouvel employeur n'a pas r√©pondu √† la r√©clamation et ne s'est pas pr√©sent√© devant le tribunal. √Ä la lumi√®re de ces faits, la juge a conclu que le nouvel employeur avait viol√© le contrat d'emploi en y mettant fin de fa√ßon unilat√©rale sans pr√©avis ni motif.

La juge a d√©clar√© qu'un contrat d'emploi cr√©e une relation d'emploi avant m√™me que l'employ√© ne commence √† travailler. Lorsque cette relation prend fin, l'employ√© a droit √† un pr√©avis ou √† une indemnit√© tenant lieu de pr√©avis. La juge a √©galement conclu que la p√©riode de probation incluse dans le contrat (laquelle permet une cessation d'emploi √† tout moment au cours des trois premiers mois sans pr√©avis ni indemnit√© tenant lieu de pr√©avis) ne s'appliquait pas, car l'employ√© n'a jamais eu l'occasion de travailler et d'entamer sa p√©riode de probation. Comme dans toutes les autres affaires de cong√©diement injustifi√©, la juge a indiqu√© que la p√©riode de pr√©avis raisonnable devait √™tre calcul√©e en fonction de la nature de l'emploi, de l'√¢ge et du nombre d'ann√©es de service de l'employ√©, de la possibilit√© d'obtenir un emploi similaire et d'autres facteurs pertinents. Compte tenu de ces facteurs, ainsi que de l'incitation faite √† l'employ√©, la juge a accord√© des dommages √©quivalents √† trois mois de salaire au niveau promis dans le contrat d'emploi, d√©duction faite de ses revenus provenant de son nouvel emploi pendant cette p√©riode.

Le√ßons √† tirer pour les employeurs

Il est important de garder √† l'esprit que les faits rapport√©s par l'employ√© ont √©t√© r√©put√©s √™tre admis par le nouvel employeur, car celui-ci n'a pas contest√© la r√©clamation. La juge a fond√© son raisonnement sur ces faits. En outre, la juge n'a pas indiqu√© si le contrat d'emploi comprenait une clause de cessation d'emploi valide qui aurait pu limiter les droits de pr√©avis raisonnable de l'employ√© prescrits par la common law. Il est probable que cela n'√©tait pas le cas, car elle aurait eu une incidence sur l'analyse et aurait limit√© les dommages accord√©s.

Cette d√©cision d√©montre l'un des risques de retirer une offre d'emploi accept√©e, et plus particuli√®rement apr√®s que l'employ√© embauch√© ait donn√© son avis de d√©mission √† son ancien employeur. Un contrat d'emploi entre en vigueur d√®s qu'il est sign√© par les parties m√™me si l'employ√© n'a pas encore commenc√© √† travailler. La r√©siliation du contrat d'emploi pourrait donner lieu √† des droits prescrits par la common law au moment de la r√©siliation s'ils ne sont pas limit√©s par une clause de cessation d'emploi valide.

subject: Re: Exciting Road Ahead: Our Comprehensive Acquisition Strategy Unveiled
body:
Hi,
Thank you Maria and Claudia for the drafts of the videos ! I think your
choice of topics and ideas are very good !!
I wanted to suggest a formula for structuring the format of the script for
the videos about your ideas. The goal is to provide maximum value to our
audience, without any ask or salesy tone. We want to give away the
information to sell the implementation after.

Here's the breakdown:
Formula Explanation:

Hook / Question:

   - Purpose: Secure immediate engagement.
   - How to Use: Address a pain point or common curiosity within HR that
   resonates with entrepreneurs.

Hammer:

   - Purpose: Deliver a strong, impactful statement or fact.
   - How to Use: Present a compelling statistic, a bold declaration, or a
   critical observation.

Example:

   - Purpose: Offer relatability and context.
   - How to Use: Craft a scenario that reflects challenges faced by
   entrepreneurs in HR.

Explanation:

   - Purpose: Provide actionable and tactical insight.
   - How to Use: Delve deep into the topic, offering viewers practical
   strategies or insights.

Example Script:

Hook / Question: "Ever felt that despite your best hiring efforts, your
team's productivity doesn‚Äôt match your expectations?"

Hammer: "Here's a hard truth: 70% of businesses that don't use KPIs in
their HR strategy face inefficiencies. If you're not measuring, you're not
improving."

Example: "Consider Jake, a tech entrepreneur. He hired top-tier talent but
noticed his projects were often delayed. Without KPIs, he was navigating in
the dark."

Explanation: "The art of enhancing team performance lies in KPIs. Here's
how you can tactically use them:

   - Define Clear Objectives: Understand your business aims for the next
   quarter or year.
   - Relevant KPIs Only: Measure key metrics that align with business
   goals, like 'time taken per task'.
   - Regular Review: Review KPIs consistently, motivating teams through
   transparency.
   - Actionable Insights: Address underperforming KPIs by finding and
   resolving the root cause.

KPIs aren‚Äôt just numbers; they guide businesses to success."

When addressing HR challenges, avoid a preachy tone which can seem
condescending to entrepreneurs; this often backfires. Instead of presenting
'best practices,' share 'our observations' from real-case (or hypothetical)
scenarios to give the HR tips. Speak about genuine HR experiences,
emphasizing that these insights stem from working with various businesses.

I hope this structure clarifies and streamlines the approach for both of
you when crafting scripts for filming. It's important that our content
remains actionable, value-driven, and free from any salesy undertones. With
your ideas and HR expertise combined with this format, I believe we can
consistently produce content that resonates with our target audience,
positioning us as authoritative figures in the HR space.

Have a great evening !

subject: Exciting Road Ahead: Our Comprehensive Acquisition Strategy Unveiled
body:
Hello Team,

I hope this email finds you all in good health and high spirits. As we
venture further into our growth trajectory, I'm elated to share our
upcoming acquisition strategy, designed to further elevate our positioning,
enhance client engagement, and establish our brand more robustly in the
market.

Cold Reach Outs: *Kassem and Pierre* are stepping up to champion this
front. Their collective objective is to achieve at least *50 cold calls per
day each, so 100 cold calls per day*. Every "no" gets us closer to a "yes",
and every connection brings us a step closer to sealing the deal. It's time
to get in the arena and make some noise.

Strategic Partnerships: *Felix and I* are shifting our attention to forging
key alliances. We're targeting partnerships with recruiting agencies,
lawyers, accountants, and marketing agencies. *1,000 strategic partner
reach outs each* (100 reach outs x 5 days), 2,000 combined. Every
connection is a step towards multiplying our influence.

CV Blast Initiative: Amplifying our reach, I'll be sending out CV blasts
offering a complimentary 1-hour consultation with Claudia. I will also
emphasize our burgeoning partnerships with recruiting agencies. *700 CV per
day.*

Educational Content: Addressing real-time queries offers immense value.
Every time Claudia and Maria encounter client questions, they'll document
them. They'll then craft *three short video*, value-driven videos
addressing each query per week (1 min maximum, in very simple language to
provide useful knowledge to entrepreneurs). These will be distributed
across Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and TikTok. Let's not just inform;
let's blow minds. We‚Äôre here to disrupt and set new standards.

Content Repurposing: *Marie-Christine and I* are at the helm of this.
They'll adapt the video content into captivating visual creatives with
fitting textual content. Their work ensures a consistent daily presence on
our social media, keeping our brand top-of-mind. *1 post per day.*

Client Referral Incentive: People talk. Let's give them something with
immense value to talk about. We're introducing a referral incentive for our
clients, enhancing loyalty and drawing in potential leads. We give 50 $ for
every referral.

Post-Service Engagement: After-service isn't an end, but a new
beginning. *Pierre
and Kassem* will touch base with clients to get feedback, encourage Google
reviews, and identify upselling opportunities. They'll also explore
potential referrals, leveraging client satisfaction. It's where we explore
new horizons, upsell, and cement our relationships into unbreakable long
term bonds.

Weekly Action Breakdown:

Pierre & Kassem:
*500 cold reach outs* each (50 calls x 5 days).
JS & Felix:
1,000 strategic partner reach outs each (100 reach outs x 5 days), *2,000*
 combined.
JS:
*3,500* CV blasts (700 CVs x 5 days).
Claudia & Maria:
3 videos each, totaling *6*.
J-S & Marie-Christine:
*7* creative posts combined in the week.

I urge each one of you to *block dedicated, non-negotiable time in your
agendas to complete these tasks every day.* This time should be free from
interruptions, ensuring you can focus and deliver optimally. We're on the
cusp of taking massive action, aiming to create a wave and capture
unparalleled attention in the market. Remember, obscurity is our biggest
enemy ‚Äì let‚Äôs get everywhere and be unmissable.

Let's come together, be relentless, and carve out our success story. Onward
and upward!

Full throttle ahead! Let's go !!!

Jean-Samuel

subject: Service RH
body:
Good evening,

I just wanted to share an idea, that I strongly believe we should evaluate,
 to proactively reach company goals,

What : bundles ( hourly)
Why; reach goal quicker ( and not everyone will use their hours)
How; selling bundles of hours
Who; all of us ,everywhere, every time,
When; after discussion

Basically continuing selling bundles, excluding recruiting, but putting a
hourly limit de the agreement ,

Ex;

2700$/mois pour 20h ou 3900$/mois pour 30h , just as an example!

Thanks
raw_content:
DATE: Thu, 10 Aug 2023 18:19:15 -0400
FROM: Kassem Durra <kassem@rhsupport.ca>
TO: C-e-d L <info@cedricleboeuf.com>, Claudia <claudia@rhsupport.ca>, Jean-Samuel Leboeuf <jsleboeuf3@gmail.com>, felix hamel <felixhamel1991@gmail.com>

Good evening,

I just wanted to share an idea, that I strongly believe we should evaluate,
 to proactively reach company goals,

What : bundles ( hourly)
Why; reach goal quicker ( and not everyone will use their hours)
How; selling bundles of hours
Who; all of us ,everywhere, every time,
When; after discussion

Basically continuing selling bundles, excluding recruiting, but putting a
hourly limit de the agreement ,

Ex;

2700$/mois pour 20h ou 3900$/mois pour 30h , just as an example!

Thanks

your human resources matters; from attracting great teachers to developing

worth trying to call tomorrow, or even passing by if they are closed,

Customer Service Representative
Universal Contracting & SolarFort Myers, FL
Quick Apply
<https://www.simplyhired.com/out?r=fY4jwdVUhuyRYV659wl3FWGRjm_oPiKLFxTfMzTdP3PSitJl4dvFKCqInUyvfhNpfHv14I308S-wnz4vnsPhKneWGnrGiiX9xpB3VAyC1EDMYymR0rtXp3g5dFxiE3g6FbuKIaLHYxMIFg>
Job Details
Part-time | Full-timeFrom $100,000 a year3 hours ago
Benefits

   - Health insurance
   - Dental insurance
   - 401(k)
   - Paid time off
   - Vision insurance
   - Flexible schedule

Qualifications

   - Sales
   - Customer service
   - No experience needed
   - Under 1 year

Full Job Description

*!!!URGENTLY HIRING SALES STAFF!!! *This is the perfect time to join a well
established local roofing company with the ability to sell solar! *Right
now there is a unique opportunity to help the people of our community and
make a significant amount of money while doing so!*

Have you ever thought about joining a sales team that can teach you step by
step exactly how to reach 7 figures in sales??? If you have answered yes,
then this might be the opportunity you have been waiting for!

*WHO WE ARE:*

We are a family owned and run roofing and solar company with over 25 years
of experience. We have offices in Fort Myers, Tampa, and Orlando and are
currently have projects all over the state of Florida. We have a culture
that truly cares about you and the community. If you don't have experience
- DON'T WORRY - We offer a great training program in a team environment.

Please feel free to visit www.ucroof.com

*WHO YOU ARE:*

   - Self-motivated and ambitious Individuals
   - People who are willing to learn and be coachable
   - People looking for a career where you can advance quickly
   - College Students who need flexibility
   - People who are willing to network
   - Previous sales experience (not required)
   - Competitive $$$ - We have great sales contests

*The ideal candidate will:*

   - Develop relationships with people in our communities and network
   yourself in order to help others
   - Learn how to educate people on roofing, insurance, and solar
   - Make your own schedule but be present for team meetings and events.
   - Ask when needing help or additional training.

*Tasks and Responsibilities:*

   - Residential / commercial roofing and solar sales
   - Product knowledge on all roofing and solar materials
   - Finance training
   - Closing deals and signing contracts
   - Perform energy efficiency audits to help customers save money
   - Be able to use our industry leading CRM
   - Learn how to market yourself with the help of our marketing team
   - Provide the best customer service

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: From $100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

   - 401(k)
   - Dental insurance
   - Flexible schedule
   - Health insurance
   - Paid time off
   - Vision insurance

Experience level:

   - No experience needed

Shift:

   - Day shift
   - Evening shift

Weekly day range:

   - Monday to Friday
   - Weekends as needed

Experience:

   - Sales: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

body:
Hey Cedric!

Hope you're enjoying your weekend!!

I just received a message from Jason Redman (regional manager of business
development candidate) with his availability; based on that, I've scheduled
for us to meet with him on *Wednesday, August 2nd at 2:30PM.*

Please reach out if you need anything else from me on this.

Take care,
Maria

*Maria F. Perez-Marom*

Head of HR Consulting & Outsourcing Services

HRSupport - USA

maria@hrsupportusa.com

561-889-0038




On Fri, Jul 28, 2023 at 3:35‚ÄØPM Maria Perez-Marom <maria@hrsupportusa.com>
wrote:

> Hi Cedric,
>
> Based on our conversation, I've sent Jason the email below.  Once he gives
> me his availability I'll schedule time on your calendar accordingly so you
> can meet with Jason.
>
> As a recap to our phone conversation, here are a few topics he is
> looking for answers to:
>
>    1. *HR Support USA's stability and growth projections*
>       1. He is under the impression that BLOOM is funding HR Support, so
>       he wants to know how successful BLOOM is in the USA. *I told him
>       that HR Support is independently funded directly by Cedric after he
>       sold the chain of dentists offices for over $58M.*
>    2. *Requested our price model so he can research and make sure we are
>    competitive.* *To this, I explained we are flexible in our price
>    offerings as we want to get our business up and running.  As a result, we
>    offer a full HR suite of services for a fraction of what a company would
>    invest in a full blown HR person's annual salary and that our prices are
>    "under construction" with that strategy in mind.*
>
> He is very interested in working for us but wants to make sure he is
> making the right decision.
>
> Please let me know if you have any further questions.
>
> Warm regards,
> Maria
>
> PS: I added my picture as you had suggested yesterday! üòâ
>
> *Maria F. Perez-Marom*

subject: Fwd: Websites: HR Support USA & BLOOM Accounting
body:
Hi Cedric,

Based on our conversation, I've sent Jason the email below.  Once he gives
me his availability I'll schedule time on your calendar accordingly so you
can meet with Jason.

As a recap to our phone conversation, here are a few topics he is
looking for answers to:

   1. *HR Support USA's stability and growth projections*
      1. He is under the impression that BLOOM is funding HR Support, so he
      wants to know how successful BLOOM is in the USA. *I told him that HR
      Support is independently funded directly by Cedric after he sold
the chain
      of dentists offices for over $58M.*
   2. *Requested our price model so he can research and make sure we are
   competitive.* *To this, I explained we are flexible in our price
   offerings as we want to get our business up and running.  As a result, we
   offer a full HR suite of services for a fraction of what a company would
   invest in a full blown HR person's annual salary and that our prices are
   "under construction" with that strategy in mind.*

He is very interested in working for us but wants to make sure he is making
the right decision.

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

Warm regards,
Maria

subject: Virtual Office
body:
Dear Sales Team,

We are excited to announce that we have created a Virtual Office for all of
us. This online space, specifically designed for our team, aims to enhance
our dynamism, strengthen our sense of belonging, and facilitate our daily
communication.

The Virtual Office is more than just a remote workspace. It's a place of
collaboration and motivation where we can all share tips, answer each
other's questions, and even conduct our call sessions together. The idea is
to recreate the atmosphere of a physical office while allowing us to work
remotely.

Here are some of the benefits that the Virtual Office can offer:

Collective Motivation and Stimulation: By working together in a virtual
space, we can recreate the camaraderie and energy that exist in a physical
office. We can cheer each other on and share our successes throughout the
day.

Sharing of Tips and Knowledge: The Virtual Office will be an ideal place
for sharing sales advice, tips, and techniques. Each team member can share
what works for them and learn from others.

Instant Support: If you have a question or if you encounter a challenge,
you can instantly ask for help from your colleagues. Plus, the management
team will be on hand to answer your queries and provide support.

Joint Call Sessions: We can organize joint call sessions where we all work
together. This will not only foster team spirit, but it will also enable
sharing effective call and closing techniques.

We believe that the Virtual Office will be a valuable asset to our team and
we look forward to seeing how it will enhance our daily work and overall
performance.

We invite you to log in and explore the Virtual Office as soon as possible.
Please feel free to share your feedback and suggestions to further improve
this space.

Let's stay connected and succeed together!

Best Regards,

Jean-Samuel

subject: Recognition for your Extraordinary Dedication and Success, Maria
body:
Hi Maria,

I want to express our deepest gratitude for your recent exceptional
efforts. The speed, efficiency, and professionalism you showed in promptly
filling the Business Development role was nothing short of remarkable.

Working hard, you have shown a commitment and dedication to our principles
that is truly inspiring. Your ability to translate these principles into
profitable actions sets a sterling example for our entire team.

Thank you for your tireless dedication and the significant impact you are
making on our operations. Your leadership in People Operations is truly
great and has an enormous positive impact on our company.

Once again, thank you for your outstanding efforts.

Best Regards,

C√©dric, F√©lix and Jean-Samuel

subject: Nos valeurs fondamentales
body:
Ch√®re √©quipe,

Je voulais prendre un moment pour partager avec vous quelques r√©flexions
alors que nous avan√ßons ensemble dans la construction de notre entreprise
estim√©e. En tant que propri√©taire, je crois qu'il est crucial que nous
soyons sur la m√™me longueur d'onde concernant nos valeurs fondamentales et
nos pratiques.

   1. Ex√©cution Rapide: Soyons agiles dans l'action - mettons rapidement
   les plans en mouvement pour rester en t√™te de la concurrence.
   2. Sessions de Retour d'Information Courageuses: Je vous encourage √†
   participer √† nos sessions de feedback hebdomadaires - un espace s√ªr pour
   grandir ensemble gr√¢ce √† une communication honn√™te.
   3. R√©soudre les Probl√®mes R√©currents avec des Solutions Permanentes:
   Lorsque nous rencontrons des probl√®mes r√©currents, engageons-nous √† ne pas
   seulement les r√©soudre temporairement, mais √† trouver et mettre en ≈ìuvre
   des solutions durables.
   4. La Confiance et les Comp√©tences vont de Pair: Notre culture prosp√®re
   sur la confiance. Construisons un environnement o√π les comp√©tences de
   chacun brillent et o√π la confiance est mutuelle.
   5. Soyons Intelligents - Utilisons des Donn√©es: Nos d√©cisions doivent
   √™tre guid√©es par des faits et des chiffres. Cela garantira que nos choix
   sont √©clair√©s et efficaces.
   6. La Simplicit√© est la Cl√©: Si un processus peut √™tre simplifi√©,
   faisons-le. Cela fait gagner du temps et √©vite la confusion.
   7. Vous √™tes digne de Confiance ; D√©ployez vos Ailes: Je vous fais
   confiance. Vous √™tes des experts dans vos domaines et je veux que vous
   assumiez vos responsabilit√©s sans vous sentir sous surveillance constante.
   8. Ensemble, Nous sommes une Force: Notre objectif est d'√™tre l'endroit
   o√π tout le monde veut travailler - et c'est un t√©moignage de nos efforts
   conjugu√©s.
   9. Nous Embauchons les Meilleurs ; Nous Agissons Rapidement: Notre
   processus de recrutement est rigoureux pour une raison. Nous voulons les
   meilleurs talents. Et nous savons quand agir rapidement pour prendre des
   d√©cisions importantes.
   10. La Confiance est Primordiale: Bien que les comp√©tences soient
   cruciales, la fiabilit√© l'emporte. Une √©quipe digne de confiance peut
   apprendre n'importe quelle comp√©tence.
   11. Diriger Positivement: Ensemble, soyons des guides les uns pour les
   autres et construisons un environnement o√π la positivit√© est la devise.
   12. Action R√©fl√©chie: R√©fl√©chissons √† nos actions, apprenons, puis
   agissons avec d√©termination et clart√©.
   13. Les Yeux sur l'Horizon avec les Pieds sur Terre: Notre vision √† long
   terme est guid√©e par l'int√©grit√© et l'intelligence. R√™vons grand, mais
   restons ancr√©s.
   14. Nous Gagnons Tous Ici: Nous sommes tous dans le m√™me bateau - quand
   l'un de nous gagne, nous gagnons tous.
   15. Restez Curieux, Restez Innovant: Les questions et la cr√©ativit√© sont
   encourag√©es ; brisons les moules et construisons du neuf.
   16.

   Clart√© dans Nos R√¥les: Je veux que tout

   le monde sache clairement ce qui est attendu d‚Äôeux. En cas de doute,
   n'h√©sitez jamais √† demander.
   17.

   Listes de Contr√¥le - Notre √âtoile du Nord: Utilisez des listes de
   contr√¥le pour rester au top de vos priorit√©s et vous assurer que rien ne
   soit n√©glig√©.
   18. Innovation avec Suivi: Soyons la source d'innovation, mais
   n'oublions jamais l'importance de concr√©tiser ces innovations.
   19. Nous Sommes une Famille; Collaborons: Nous sommes unis. La
   collaboration n'est pas qu'un mot ; c'est notre fa√ßon de tisser de la magie
   ensemble.
   20. Employ√©s Heureux, Clients Satisfaits, Entreprise Florissante: Notre
   bonheur se refl√®te dans notre travail. Des clients satisfaits et une
   entreprise florissante sont la cerise sur le g√¢teau.
   21. Align√©s sur Notre Mission, Vision et Valeurs: Tout ce que nous
   faisons est le reflet de ce que nous d√©fendons. Assurons-nous que nos
   actions sont en accord avec nos principes fondamentaux.

Merci de faire partie int√©grante de ce voyage. Ensemble, nous continuerons
√† construire quelque chose d'extraordinaire.

Cordialement,


*Cedric Leboeuf *

   - *450 567-0514*
   - *info@cedricleboeuf.com <info@cedricleboeuf.com>*

subject: New Daily Reporting Structure & Meeting Schedule for Business Development Team
body:
Dear Team,

Welcome Onboard!!

On behalf of the executive leadership team, I wanted to convey our
commitment to driving excellence and as part of our continuous improvement
efforts, below is our daily meeting cadence which will streamline our
operation and boost our overall efficiency.

*Daily Meetings vis google meets:*

Every morning we will have the following meetings via google meets:

 1. *A**t 8:30AM - EST (sharp): **Sales Huddle RH Support / HR Support, *here
the CA & US Sales and HR teams come together as one.  As "one team," we
want to make sure our daily actions are aligned to our Principles which
states: "*We prioritize profitable and collaborative actions that elevate
the team rather than the individual;" *therefore, reiterating our culture
that we are *one team* where if one succeeds, we all succeed; as a result,
we support each other as such.

During our first morning call, we will focus on handling objections and
deeply understanding our services. This meeting will be split into two
segments: 15 minutes for drilling objections and 15 minutes for drilling
services. This exercise will accelerate our learning curve, enabling us to
confidently articulate the benefits of our offerings and respond
convincingly to objections, thereby enhancing our chances of closing deals
successfully with our prospect clients.

2. *A**t 9:15AM - EST (sharp): **HR Support - USA, *US HR and Sales team
articulates precise objectives and profitable actionable items planned for
the day.  Each member of the team will provide an overview of our US
Operations and how they are progressing to build our business.

*Daily Documentation:*

To this, the ask from each of you is to consistently record your daily
activities and meeting details in your Google Calendar and share your
calendar with Felix, Jean-Samuel, Cedric and Maria. This will not only
enhance transparency and ensure that everyone is on the same page,
facilitating improved coordination of our collective efforts, but will
also allow us to be agile with scheduling meetings based on your
availability in a quicker fashion.

*KPIs & End-of-Day Reporting:*

Effective tracking of the right metrics is critical to our success. Going
forward, we'll focus on these key performance indicators (KPIs):

*Contacts:* The number of potential clients we reach out to. This will give
us a clear picture of our market penetration and effort intensity.
*Follow-ups:* The number of follow-ups conducted. This will help us gauge
our diligence and perseverance in turning potential clients into actual
clients.
*Meetings: *The number of client meetings held. Meetings indicate the depth
of our client interactions and are often a precursor to closing deals.
*Onboardings (Signed Contracts):* The number of new clients onboarded. This
is a direct indicator of our success in converting our leads to customers.
*Sales cycle length: *Meaning, average length of sales cycle; how many
weeks until the deal was closed?
*Sales by county*: Total amount of revenue brought in per county


At the end of each day, please send a brief email to info@rhsupport.ca
detailing
your performance against these KPIs. Here's a suggested format:

Subject: Daily Performance - [Date]

Contacts: X
Follow-ups: X
Meetings: X
Onboardings: X
Sales cycle length: X
Sales by county: X

Please also share any additional insights, such as notable achievements or
challenges encountered during your client interactions. Regularly tracking
these KPIs will ensure our efforts align with our business objectives and
enable us to spot trends and make strategic decisions in a timely manner.

Once again, we are excited to have you be part of our A+ winning team!
Furthermore, we are confident these strategies will significantly enhance
our team's performance, getting us closer to our goals every hour, and
every day.

Please note, we're just a phone, or text away!
Your executive leadership team

*Maria F. Perez-Marom*

Head of HR Consulting & Outsourcing Services

HRSupport - USA

maria@hrsupportusa.com

561-889-0038

subject: Re: Recognition for your Extraordinary Dedication and Success, Maria
body:
Thank you for the kind words, it's been such a fun ride thus far!!
Love working with and for you guys!!
Looking forward to building a solid sales team, HR team and being part of
an immense profitable business where we help small/medium size businesses
thrive with their HR management operations.
Enjoy your weekend!!
PS: Next year tomorrow, I'll be there to party with you guys!!
Maria
*Maria F. Perez-Marom*

Head of HR Consulting & Outsourcing Services

HRSupport - USA

maria@hrsupportusa.com <andres@hrsupportusa.com>

561-889-0038

>

> efforts. The speed, efficiency, and professionalism you showed in promptly
> filling the Business Development role was nothing short of remarkable.

>
> Thank you for your tireless dedication and the significant impact you are
> making on our operations. Your leadership in People Operations is truly
> great and has an enormous positive impact on our company.
>
> Once again, thank you for your outstanding efforts.
>
> Best Regards,
>
> C√©dric, F√©lix and Jean-Samuel
>

On Wed, Jul 5, 2023 at 7:02‚ÄØPM Claudia Drozdoski <claudia@rhsupport.ca>
wrote:

> This is great, thank you!
>
> Le mer. 5 juill. 2023 √† 16:12, Jean-Samuel Leboeuf <jsleboeuf3@gmail.com>
> a √©crit :
>
>> Dear Team,
>>
>> Trust you are doing well. We're committed to driving excellence and as
>> part of our continuous improvement efforts, I want to share some updates
>> that will streamline our operations and boost our overall efficiency.
>>
>> *Daily Meetings:*
>>
>> Starting tomorrow, we're setting the following meeting schedule:
>>
>> 9:15 AM - Meeting with Andres and Maria from HR Support USA for an
>> overview of US operations (Felix and I will attend this).
>>
>> 9:30 AM - A 30-minute sales drilling meeting with the Business
>> Development team to focus on handling objections and deeply understanding
>> our services. This meeting will be split into two segments: 15 minutes for
>> drilling objections and 15 minutes for drilling services.This exercise will
>> accelerate our learning curve, enabling us to confidently articulate the
>> benefits of our offerings and respond convincingly to objections, thereby
>> enhancing our chances of successful client interactions.
>>
>> *Daily Documentation:*
>>
>> If not already in practice, I request all team members from both Business
>> Development and HR departments to consistently record their daily
>> activities and meeting details in Google Calendar. This will enhance
>> transparency and ensure that everyone is on the same page, facilitating
>> improved coordination of our collective efforts.
>>
>> *KPIs & End-of-Day Reporting:*
>>
>> Effective tracking of the right metrics is critical to our success. Going
>> forward, we'll focus on these key performance indicators (KPIs):
>>
>> Contacts: The number of potential clients we reach out to. This will give
>> us a clear picture of our market penetration and effort intensity.
>> Follow-ups: The number of follow-ups conducted. This will help us gauge
>> our diligence and perseverance in turning potential clients into actual
>> clients.
>> Meetings: The number of client meetings held. Meetings indicate the depth
>> of our client interactions and are often a precursor to closing deals.
>> Onboardings: The number of new clients onboarded. This is a direct
>> indicator of our success in converting our leads to customers.
>>
>> At the end of each day, please send a brief email to info@rhsupport.ca
>> detailing your performance against these KPIs. Here's a suggested format:
>>
>> Subject: Daily Performance - [Date]
>>
>> Contacts: X
>> Follow-ups: X
>> Meetings: X
>> Onboardings: X
>>
>> Please also share any additional insights, such as notable achievements
>> or challenges encountered during your client interactions. Regularly
>> tracking these KPIs will ensure our efforts align with our business
>> objectives and enable us to spot trends and make strategic decisions in a
>> timely manner.
>>
>> Thank you for your understanding and collaboration. I am confident these
>> strategies will significantly enhance our team's performance, getting us
>> closer to our goals every day.
>>
>> Best,
>>
>> Jean-Samuel
>> Co-Founder
>>
>

subject: New Daily Reporting Structure & Meeting Schedule for Business Development Team
body:
Dear Team,

Trust you are doing well. We're committed to driving excellence and as part
of our continuous improvement efforts, I want to share some updates that
will streamline our operations and boost our overall efficiency.

*Daily Meetings:*

Starting tomorrow, we're setting the following meeting schedule:

9:15 AM - Meeting with Andres and Maria from HR Support USA for an overview
of US operations (Felix and I will attend this).

9:30 AM - A 30-minute sales drilling meeting with the Business Development
team to focus on handling objections and deeply understanding our services.
This meeting will be split into two segments: 15 minutes for drilling
objections and 15 minutes for drilling services.This exercise will
accelerate our learning curve, enabling us to confidently articulate the
benefits of our offerings and respond convincingly to objections, thereby
enhancing our chances of successful client interactions.

*Daily Documentation:*

If not already in practice, I request all team members from both Business
Development and HR departments to consistently record their daily
activities and meeting details in Google Calendar. This will enhance
transparency and ensure that everyone is on the same page, facilitating
improved coordination of our collective efforts.

*KPIs & End-of-Day Reporting:*

Effective tracking of the right metrics is critical to our success. Going
forward, we'll focus on these key performance indicators (KPIs):

Contacts: The number of potential clients we reach out to. This will give
us a clear picture of our market penetration and effort intensity.
Follow-ups: The number of follow-ups conducted. This will help us gauge our
diligence and perseverance in turning potential clients into actual clients.
Meetings: The number of client meetings held. Meetings indicate the depth
of our client interactions and are often a precursor to closing deals.
Onboardings: The number of new clients onboarded. This is a direct
indicator of our success in converting our leads to customers.

At the end of each day, please send a brief email to info@rhsupport.ca
detailing your performance against these KPIs. Here's a suggested format:

Subject: Daily Performance - [Date]

Contacts: X
Follow-ups: X
Meetings: X
Onboardings: X

Please also share any additional insights, such as notable achievements or
challenges encountered during your client interactions. Regularly tracking
these KPIs will ensure our efforts align with our business objectives and
enable us to spot trends and make strategic decisions in a timely manner.

Thank you for your understanding and collaboration. I am confident these
strategies will significantly enhance our team's performance, getting us
closer to our goals every day.

Best,

Jean-Samuel
Co-Founder

SUBJECT: New Daily Reporting Structure & Meeting Schedule for Business Development Team
------------------------------------------------------------
Dear Team,

Trust you are doing well. We're committed to driving excellence and as part
of our continuous improvement efforts, I want to share some updates that
will streamline our operations and boost our overall efficiency.

*Daily Meetings:*

Starting tomorrow, we're setting the following meeting schedule:

9:15 AM - Meeting with Andres and Maria from HR Support USA for an overview
of US operations (Felix and I will attend this).

9:30 AM - A 30-minute sales drilling meeting with the Business Development
team to focus on handling objections and deeply understanding our services.
This meeting will be split into two segments: 15 minutes for drilling
objections and 15 minutes for drilling services.This exercise will
accelerate our learning curve, enabling us to confidently articulate the
benefits of our offerings and respond convincingly to objections, thereby
enhancing our chances of successful client interactions.

*Daily Documentation:*

If not already in practice, I request all team members from both Business
Development and HR departments to consistently record their daily
activities and meeting details in Google Calendar. This will enhance
transparency and ensure that everyone is on the same page, facilitating
improved coordination of our collective efforts.

*KPIs & End-of-Day Reporting:*

Effective tracking of the right metrics is critical to our success. Going
forward, we'll focus on these key performance indicators (KPIs):

Contacts: The number of potential clients we reach out to. This will give
us a clear picture of our market penetration and effort intensity.
Follow-ups: The number of follow-ups conducted. This will help us gauge our
diligence and perseverance in turning potential clients into actual clients.
Meetings: The number of client meetings held. Meetings indicate the depth
of our client interactions and are often a precursor to closing deals.
Onboardings: The number of new clients onboarded. This is a direct
indicator of our success in converting our leads to customers.

At the end of each day, please send a brief email to info@rhsupport.ca
detailing your performance against these KPIs. Here's a suggested format:

Subject: Daily Performance - [Date]

Contacts: X
Follow-ups: X
Meetings: X
Onboardings: X

Please also share any additional insights, such as notable achievements or
challenges encountered during your client interactions. Regularly tracking
these KPIs will ensure our efforts align with our business objectives and
enable us to spot trends and make strategic decisions in a timely manner.

Thank you for your understanding and collaboration. I am confident these
strategies will significantly enhance our team's performance, getting us
closer to our goals every day.

Best,

Jean-Samuel
Co-Founder

body:
We've been giving some thought to our growth strategy and the role of our
partners in this process. There are two key points that we'd like to
address.

Firstly, we want to emphasize the importance of full focus and dedication.
As a partner, we expect you to concentrate your entire efforts on one
particular business in our portfolio. By doing so, you can deeply
understand the business's landscape, identify its opportunities and
challenges, and steer it towards success. We believe that such full-time
commitment and focused attention are critical in achieving outstanding
results.

Secondly, we are introducing an exciting incentive. If you, as a partner,
can identify and recruit a superb operator for another business in our
portfolio, you will unlock phantom equity in that business. Phantom equity
is a promise to pay a sum in the future equivalent to the value of a
certain number of shares. In this case, the better the operator performs,
the more the business's value can increase, and consequently, the more
valuable your phantom equity stake can become. This way, you are directly
rewarded for your ability to find high-performing talent.

Through this approach, we aim to encourage focus on individual businesses
while also incentivizing the active search for top-notch operators across
our portfolio. This creates a win-win situation where everyone is geared
towards the common goal of enhancing the value of our portfolio.

We believe these steps will result in an even stronger, more focused team
and will fuel our collective success. Do you have any thoughts or questions
about this approach?

subject: One paper hand out
body:
Good day,

I hope all is well,

I would like for the sales team, to have one pagers hand outs; clear,
straight to the point, pricing and terms for recruiting services,

Genre dans le style;

Intro: une ou deux phrase sur notre recrutement,

Prix: 15%

Garantie 3 mois ( ou le nombre que vous voulez)

Service RH, en une phrase qui d√©crit tous ce qu‚Äôon fait,

Notre vision en bas de la page!

And that‚Äôs it!

Avec notre logo bien sure, et de la couleur!

Dans pas long je vais commencer le cold call en personne , et laisser des
documents un peu partout, m√™me la fin de semaine lorsque je sort, mark√©ting
√† la Max, on devrait tous faire cela, pour maximiser la vue et le nom de RH
Support!

Si on va au resto, centre d‚Äôamusement pour enfant, coiffeur, d√©panneur ,
m√©dical priver, dentiste, acheter une auto, r√©parer une auto, basically
n‚Äôimporte quel service, on laisse une feuille,

M√™me pour bloom et aider Marie Christine. les gens de bloom, vont laisser
nos feuille aussi,

J‚Äôaimerais en parler lundi,

On est une nouvelle compagnie, et je r√©alise de plus en plus, et on a
besoin d‚Äô√™tre connu, et rapidement, we need some kind of marketing and
personal marketing is the best,

On est peut √™tre 10 dans le bureau, si on laisse ch un minimum de 1 par
jour, sa fait 300 porte dans le mois, et je suis sure qu‚Äôon peut en laisser
plus que une ch par jour,

We have no choice but to grow together.

Let‚Äôs grow and bloom together!

subject: Re: Thank you
body:
Hello Cedric (and Team)

I am definitely energized and feeling very excited and extremely grateful
for this opportunity. I appreciate your message and positive words
recognizing my level of dedication towards our common cause, thank you!

I also appreciate the time we spent the time together getting to know each
other better. It is great to be a part of such a dynamic team and bring
additional value to our noble cause.

Let's go team HRSupport!!

Sincerely,
Andres

On Thu, Jun 22, 2023 at 10:41‚ÄØAM C-e-d L <info@cedricleboeuf.com> wrote:

> Dear Andres,
>
> I hope this message finds you well and energized. I wanted to take a
> moment to personally thank you for your exceptional work during your first
> few days with us. Your passion and dedication have made a significant
> impression.
>
> As you are aware, we are incredibly proud to become the leading provider
> of HR services, an achievement that is only possible thanks to our
> outstanding team and our satisfied clients. Our mission is to find, retain,
> and develop potential within every employee and every client by offering a
> personalized experience that goes beyond expectations. Your efforts in this
> regard are greatly appreciated.
>
> We have noticed your profitable actions which reflect your commitment to
> our vision, mission, and values. You have brought a fresh dynamic to our
> team and we are excited to see how your role will evolve and contribute
> even more to our collective success.
>
> I also want to assure you that we will maintain close communication. If
> there is ever anything you need or if you have any questions, please do not
> hesitate to let us know. We are here to support you.
>
> Finally, I'd like to emphasize the importance of being 100% dedicated to
> profitable actions. This focus is at the heart of everything we do and I am
> confident that your business-oriented approach will be a major asset to us.
>
> Once again, thank you for your efforts and your commitment. We look
> forward to seeing what the future holds.
>
> Best Regards,
>
> Cedric
>


-- 

*Andres Gonzalez, MBA*

Director of Business Development

HRSupport (USA)

andres@hrsupportusa.com

561-213-2638

subject: Thank you
body:
Dear Andres,

I hope this message finds you well and energized. I wanted to take a moment
to personally thank you for your exceptional work during your first few
days with us. Your passion and dedication have made a significant
impression.

As you are aware, we are incredibly proud to become the leading provider of
HR services, an achievement that is only possible thanks to our outstanding
team and our satisfied clients. Our mission is to find, retain, and develop
potential within every employee and every client by offering a personalized
experience that goes beyond expectations. Your efforts in this regard are
greatly appreciated.

We have noticed your profitable actions which reflect your commitment to
our vision, mission, and values. You have brought a fresh dynamic to our
team and we are excited to see how your role will evolve and contribute
even more to our collective success.

I also want to assure you that we will maintain close communication. If
there is ever anything you need or if you have any questions, please do not
hesitate to let us know. We are here to support you.

Finally, I'd like to emphasize the importance of being 100% dedicated to
profitable actions. This focus is at the heart of everything we do and I am
confident that your business-oriented approach will be a major asset to us.

Once again, thank you for your efforts and your commitment. We look forward
to seeing what the future holds.

Best Regards,

Cedric

DATE: Thu, 22 Jun 2023 10:41:42 -0400
FROM: C-e-d L <info@cedricleboeuf.com>
TO: andres@hrsupportusa.com, Jean-Samuel Leboeuf <jsleboeuf3@gmail.com>, Felix <Felixhamel1991@gmail.com>
SUBJECT: Thank you
------------------------------------------------------------
Dear Andres,

I hope this message finds you well and energized. I wanted to take a moment
to personally thank you for your exceptional work during your first few
days with us. Your passion and dedication have made a significant
impression.

As you are aware, we are incredibly proud to become the leading provider of
HR services, an achievement that is only possible thanks to our outstanding
team and our satisfied clients. Our mission is to find, retain, and develop
potential within every employee and every client by offering a personalized
experience that goes beyond expectations. Your efforts in this regard are
greatly appreciated.

We have noticed your profitable actions which reflect your commitment to
our vision, mission, and values. You have brought a fresh dynamic to our
team and we are excited to see how your role will evolve and contribute
even more to our collective success.

I also want to assure you that we will maintain close communication. If
there is ever anything you need or if you have any questions, please do not
hesitate to let us know. We are here to support you.

Finally, I'd like to emphasize the importance of being 100% dedicated to
profitable actions. This focus is at the heart of everything we do and I am
confident that your business-oriented approach will be a major asset to us.

Once again, thank you for your efforts and your commitment. We look forward
to seeing what the future holds.

Best Regards,

Cedric

>>>    execution speed is a significant weakness. Slow processes lead to friction,
>>>    confusion about who to consult, and lack of communication.
>>>    - - There's an issue with the corporate ladder and lack of clarity
>>>    on hierarchy, resulting in confusion and chaos.
>>>    - - Leadership development is a focus, with initiatives to foster a
>>>    solution-based mindset among leaders and provide tools for practice
>>>    managers to lead effectively.
>>>    - - Despite being a young company, it has grown significantly,

>>>    payroll, but this has led to errors, miscommunication, and further

>>> notre mission de RH. Ce sera l'occasion de renforcer la confiance et de

>>>

>>> d√©finirons explicitement les r√¥les et les responsabilit√©s de la Directrice
>>> R√©gionale et des Practice Managers, soulignant l'importance de la clart√©
>>> pour √©viter les malentendus. Nous discuterons √©galement des listes de
>>> contr√¥le, mettant l'accent sur la simplicit√© et la clart√© comme √©l√©ments
>>> cl√©s de notre organisation.
>>>
>>> IV. Formation sur les comp√©tences de leadership (60 minutes) : Cette
>>> session de formation sera ax√©e sur la promotion de comp√©tences de
>>> leadership solides parmi les Practice Managers et la nouvelle Directrice
>>> R√©gionale. Nous couvrirons des aspects tels que la r√©solution de probl√®mes
>>> r√©currents avec des solutions permanentes, la confiance et les comp√©tences
>>> allant de pair, et diriger positivement.
>>>
>>> V. Pr√©sentation des valeurs fondamentales (45 minutes) : Nous

>>> √©vidence comment elles guident nos d√©cisions et notre conduite. Nous
>>> discuterons de comment les int√©grer dans notre travail quotidien et
>>> renforcer notre sentiment d'appartenance.
>>>
>>> VI. Discussion et Session de questions-r√©ponses (30 minutes) : Nous
>>> ouvrirons une session de discussion pour permettre √† tous les participants
>>> d'exprimer leurs id√©es, leurs pr√©occupations et de poser des questions.
>>> Cette session sera guid√©e par notre valeur fondamentale d'encourager la
>>> curiosit√© et l'innovation.
>>>
>>> VII. Conclusion et Plan d'action (30 minutes) : Nous conclurons
>>> l'atelier en mettant en lumi√®re les √©tapes √† suivre. Nous √©laborerons un
>>> plan d'action qui met l'accent sur l'innovation avec suivi, en assurant que

body:
Simulation du diagnostic RH

Section 1 : Trouver

Supposons qu'ils consacrent 40 heures pour rechercher et interviewer les
candidats pour chaque poste vacant. Avec un taux horaire moyen pour un
gestionnaire de 50 $, cela co√ªte 2000 $ de temps par poste.
S'ils ont eu 2 postes ouverts au cours de la derni√®re ann√©e, cela fait 4000
$ en temps de gestion.
Ils ont peut-√™tre d√©pens√© 1000 $ en frais de plateforme de recrutement par
poste, soit 2000 $.
Supposons qu'un poste vacant co√ªte environ 5% du chiffre d'affaires annuel
en perte de productivit√©, ce qui revient √† 50 000 $ pour un poste vacant de
dentiste pendant un an.
Si l'on suppose qu'ils ont manqu√© 5% d'opportunit√©s commerciales en raison
de postes vacants, cela repr√©sente 50 000 $.
Total des co√ªts de recherche d'emploi : 56 000 $

Section 2 : Fid√©liser

Disons qu'ils ont perdu un dentiste et un hygi√©niste au cours des deux
derni√®res ann√©es.
Le co√ªt de remplacement est g√©n√©ralement estim√© √† environ 20% du salaire
annuel de l'employ√©, soit environ 40 000 $ pour un dentiste et 15 000 $
pour un hygi√©niste.
La rotation du personnel peut avoir r√©duit la productivit√© de 5%, soit 50
000 $.
S'ils ont mis en place des mesures pour am√©liorer la r√©tention, comme un
programme de bien-√™tre qui co√ªte 2000 $ par an, cela repr√©sente 4000 $ sur
deux ans.
Ils ont peut-√™tre pass√© 20 heures √† g√©rer les probl√®mes de r√©tention, ce
qui co√ªte environ 1000 $ en temps de gestion.
Total des co√ªts de r√©tention du personnel : 110 000 $

Section 3 : D√©velopper

Si chaque employ√© re√ßoit une formation de 500 $ par an, cela co√ªte 5500 $
par an pour 11 employ√©s, soit 11 000 $ sur deux ans.
S'ils passent 2 heures par semaine √† coacher les employ√©s, cela co√ªte
environ 5200 $ par an en temps de gestion, soit 10 400 $ sur deux ans.
Si l'insuffisance de comp√©tences a conduit √† manquer 5% d'opportunit√©s de
croissance, cela repr√©sente 50 000 $.
Ils ont peut-√™tre d√©pens√© 10 000 $ sur des consultants externes pour le
d√©veloppement des employ√©s.
S'ils ont d√ª faire appel √† des employ√©s contractuels pour combler les
lacunes en mati√®re de comp√©tences, supposons que cela a co√ªt√© 20 000 $.
Total des co√ªts de d√©veloppement des employ√©s : 91 400 $

R√©sum√© :

Total des co√ªts de recherche d'emploi : 56 000 $
Total des co√ªts de r√©tention du personnel : 110 000 $
Total des co√ªts de d√©veloppement des employ√©s : 91 400 $
Si votre entreprise peut aider √† r√©duire ces co√ªts de 20%, ils pourraient
√©conomiser environ :

11 200 $ sur le recrutement
22 000 $ sur la r√©tention
18 280 $ sur le d√©veloppement
Cela repr√©sente une √©conomie totale de 51 480 $. De plus, si vous pouvez
aider √† augmenter leur productivit√© de 5%, cela pourrait g√©n√©rer un revenu
suppl√©mentaire de 50 000 $.

En ce qui concerne le gain en temps et en √©motion n√©gative, c'est plus
difficile √† quantifier, mais supposons que votre entreprise puisse r√©duire
le temps consacr√© √† la gestion des RH de 20%, cela signifie environ 16
heures suppl√©mentaires par mois que le gestionnaire peut consacrer √† des
activit√©s plus productives. En termes d'√©motion n√©gative, le simple fait de
savoir qu'ils ont une √©quipe RH fiable pour soutenir leurs employ√©s peut
r√©duire le stress et l'incertitude, ce qui conduit √† un environnement de
travail plus positif.

Comment est-ce qu'on pourrait charger sur cette economie et le potentiel de
revenu supplementaire
ChatGPT
Une strat√©gie courante pour fixer les prix d'un service comme le v√¥tre est
de facturer un pourcentage des √©conomies r√©alis√©es ou du revenu
suppl√©mentaire g√©n√©r√©. Cela aligne vos int√©r√™ts avec ceux du client, car
plus ils √©conomisent ou gagnent, plus vous gagnez.

Par exemple, vous pourriez facturer 20% des √©conomies et du revenu
suppl√©mentaire g√©n√©r√©. Si, comme dans l'exemple pr√©c√©dent, vous aidez une
clinique dentaire √† √©conomiser 51 480 $ et √† g√©n√©rer 50 000 $ de revenus
suppl√©mentaires, vous gagneriez :

20% de 51 480 $ = 10 296 $
20% de 50 000 $ = 10 000 $
Votre facture totale serait donc de 20 296 $.

Cela √©tant dit, chaque entreprise et chaque situation est unique, donc il
est important de consid√©rer d'autres facteurs lors de la fixation des prix.
Par exemple, la taille et les ressources de l'entreprise, la complexit√© du
travail que vous effectuez pour eux, et la valeur que vous fournissez
au-del√† des √©conomies et du revenu directement mesurables.

Il peut √©galement √™tre judicieux d'avoir une certaine structure de base de
r√©mun√©ration, pour couvrir vos co√ªts et vous assurer que vous serez pay√©
m√™me si les √©conomies ou le revenu suppl√©mentaire ne sont pas aussi √©lev√©s
que pr√©vu.

Enfin, il est toujours important de communiquer clairement et de mani√®re
transparente sur la fa√ßon dont vous fixez vos prix, afin que vos clients
comprennent ce qu'ils paient et pourquoi.

La rotation du personnel peut avoir r√©duit la productivit√© de 5%, soit 50
000 $.
S'ils ont mis en place des mesures pour am√©liorer la r√©tention, comme un
programme de bien-√™tre qui co√ªte 2000 $ par an, cela repr√©sente 4000 $ sur
deux ans.
Ils ont peut-√™tre pass√© 20 heures √† g√©rer les probl√®mes de r√©tention, ce
qui co√ªte environ 1000 $ en temps de gestion.
Total des co√ªts de r√©tention du personnel : 110 000 $

Section 3 : D√©velopper

Si chaque employ√© re√ßoit une formation de 500 $ par an, cela co√ªte 5500 $
par an pour 11 employ√©s, soit 11 000 $ sur deux ans.
S'ils passent 2 heures par semaine √† coacher les employ√©s, cela co√ªte
environ 5200 $ par an en temps de gestion, soit 10 400 $ sur deux ans.
Si l'insuffisance de comp√©tences a conduit √† manquer 5% d'opportunit√©s de
croissance, cela repr√©sente 50 000 $.
Ils ont peut-√™tre d√©pens√© 10 000 $ sur des consultants externes pour le
d√©veloppement des employ√©s.
S'ils ont d√ª faire appel √† des employ√©s contractuels pour combler les
lacunes en mati√®re de comp√©tences, supposons que cela a co√ªt√© 20 000 $.
Total des co√ªts de d√©veloppement des employ√©s : 91 400 $

R√©sum√© :

Total des co√ªts de recherche d'emploi : 56 000 $
Total des co√ªts de r√©tention du personnel : 110 000 $
Total des co√ªts de d√©veloppement des employ√©s : 91 400 $
Si votre entreprise peut aider √† r√©duire ces co√ªts de 20%, ils pourraient
√©conomiser environ :

11 200 $ sur le recrutement
22 000 $ sur la r√©tention
18 280 $ sur le d√©veloppement
Cela repr√©sente une √©conomie totale de 51 480 $. De plus, si vous pouvez
aider √† augmenter leur productivit√© de 5%, cela pourrait g√©n√©rer un revenu
suppl√©mentaire de 50 000 $.

En ce qui concerne le gain en temps et en √©motion n√©gative, c'est plus
difficile √† quantifier, mais supposons que votre entreprise puisse r√©duire
le temps consacr√© √† la gestion des RH de 20%, cela signifie environ 16
heures suppl√©mentaires par mois que le gestionnaire peut consacrer √† des
activit√©s plus productives. En termes d'√©motion n√©gative, le simple fait de
savoir qu'ils ont une √©quipe RH fiable pour soutenir leurs employ√©s peut
r√©duire le stress et l'incertitude, ce qui conduit √† un environnement de
travail plus positif.

Comment est-ce qu'on pourrait charger sur cette economie et le potentiel de
revenu supplementaire
ChatGPT
Une strat√©gie courante pour fixer les prix d'un service comme le v√¥tre est
de facturer un pourcentage des √©conomies r√©alis√©es ou du revenu
suppl√©mentaire g√©n√©r√©. Cela aligne vos int√©r√™ts avec ceux du client, car
plus ils √©conomisent ou gagnent, plus vous gagnez.

Par exemple, vous pourriez facturer 20% des √©conomies et du revenu
suppl√©mentaire g√©n√©r√©. Si, comme dans l'exemple pr√©c√©dent, vous aidez une
clinique dentaire √† √©conomiser 51 480 $ et √† g√©n√©rer 50 000 $ de revenus
suppl√©mentaires, vous gagneriez :

20% de 51 480 $ = 10 296 $
20% de 50 000 $ = 10 000 $
Votre facture totale serait donc de 20 296 $.

Cela √©tant dit, chaque entreprise et chaque situation est unique, donc il
est important de consid√©rer d'autres facteurs lors de la fixation des prix.
Par exemple, la taille et les ressources de l'entreprise, la complexit√© du
travail que vous effectuez pour eux, et la valeur que vous fournissez
au-del√† des √©conomies et du revenu directement mesurables.

Il peut √©galement √™tre judicieux d'avoir une certaine structure de base de
r√©mun√©ration, pour couvrir vos co√ªts et vous assurer que vous serez pay√©
m√™me si les √©conomies ou le revenu suppl√©mentaire ne sont pas aussi √©lev√©s
que pr√©vu.

Enfin, il est toujours important de communiquer clairement et de mani√®re
transparente sur la fa√ßon dont vous fixez vos prix, afin que vos clients
comprennent ce qu'ils paient et pourquoi.

√Ä : joelle.cote@rhsupport.ca <joelle.cote@rhsupport.ca>, Milissa Major <
Veta.major@gmail.com>


Hi Joelle,
How are you?

After my second lovely meeting with C√©dric and Milissa last Friday, I
learned you were working on my contract and would send it to me by email?
We discussed a few topics to include in the contract, and I would like to
name same of them here, in case it could to save you some back and forth
time:


   1. Salary: Would be $60.00/h (regular hours) with a restricted vet
   permit/license, to be readjusted and agreed on (according to the average
   market offer for recently graduated veterinarians) upon receipt of regular
   veterinary permit/license, in addition to a participation in the net
   profits. (What would that participation be?)


   1. Salary readjustment rate: What would be the rate (example:
   2-2.5%/year depending on performance review)?


   1. Salary rate: Would overtime hours or on call hours be applicable? If
   yes, what would be the salary rate (example: Time and a half, double time,
   etc.)?


   1. Would I be provided with uniforms (scrubs and/or lab coats) and shoes?


   1. Vacation: How many paid vacation weeks would I be entitled per year?


   1. Sick days: Would I be entitled to paid sick days per year, in case
   it's necessary to miss working hours due to sickness (myself or my
   dependant)?


   1. Would I be entitled to health + dental insurance and pension plan?
   Which one?


   1. Would I be entitled to professional liability insurance?


   1. Would I be entitled to continued education (mandatory by the order of
   vets) hours and financial support? How many/much?


   1. Would I be entitled to annual membership fees to AMVQ (Association of
   Veterinary Physicians of
   Quebec in Small Animal Practice) and OMVQ (Order of Veterinary
   Physicians of Quebec)?


   1. Would I be entitled to the annual Veterinary Practice License fee?


Also, should I be putting Cedric in CC in these emails? If yes, would you
mind forwarding me his email address for next time?

Thank you so much for your time!
I hope to have saved you some with this detailed email.

Have a wonderful day!
My best,

*Paula Alvares Lunardelli*
+1(450)631-1759

   yes, what would be the salary rate (example: Time and a half, double time,
   etc.)?


   1. Would I be provided with uniforms (scrubs and/or lab coats) and shoes?


   1. Vacation: How many paid vacation weeks would I be entitled per year?


   1. Sick days: Would I be entitled to paid sick days per year, in case
   it's necessary to miss working hours due to sickness (myself or my
   dependant)?


   1. Would I be entitled to health + dental insurance and pension plan?
   Which one?


   1. Would I be entitled to professional liability insurance?


   1. Would I be entitled to continued education (mandatory by the order of
   vets) hours and financial support? How many/much?


   1. Would I be entitled to annual membership fees to AMVQ (Association of
   Veterinary Physicians of
   Quebec in Small Animal Practice) and OMVQ (Order of Veterinary
   Physicians of Quebec)?


   1. Would I be entitled to the annual Veterinary Practice License fee?


Also, should I be putting Cedric in CC in these emails? If yes, would you
mind forwarding me his email address for next time?

Thank you so much for your time!
I hope to have saved you some with this detailed email.

Have a wonderful day!
My best,

*Paula Alvares Lunardelli*
+1(450)631-1759

subject: Bulletpoint
body:
‚Ä¢ Gateway is a new collaboration to better serve and support newcomers.

‚Ä¢ Goal is to increase organic growth through simple and concrete actions
using unique tools.

‚Ä¢ Plan is based on shared values, intent is to approach dentists with
potential and provide services and tools to integrate them under Viva/dntl.
‚Ä¢ Tools and systems created are based on opportunities that most dentists
are unaware of.
‚Ä¢ Plan includes recruiting a small team of people to help develop these
clinics and ask dentists to commit to selling to VIVA dntl or at least to
the first offer.
‚Ä¢ Will be an ambassador for the dental corporation and correct
misconceptions between dentists and the corporation.
‚Ä¢ I am the type of partner that needs to pursue growth in order to be happy.
raw_content:
DATE: Wed, 14 Dec 2022 13:17:18 -0500
FROM: Jean-Samuel Leboeuf <jsleboeuf3@gmail.com>
TO: C-e-d L <info@cedricleboeuf.com>
SUBJECT: Bulletpoint
------------------------------------------------------------
‚Ä¢ Gateway is a new collaboration to better serve and support newcomers.

‚Ä¢ Goal is to increase organic growth through simple and concrete actions
using unique tools.

‚Ä¢ Plan is based on shared values, intent is to approach dentists with
potential and provide services and tools to integrate them under Viva/dntl.
‚Ä¢ Tools and systems created are based on opportunities that most dentists
are unaware of.
‚Ä¢ Plan includes recruiting a small team of people to help develop these
clinics and ask dentists to commit to selling to VIVA dntl or at least to
the first offer.
‚Ä¢ Will be an ambassador for the dental corporation and correct
misconceptions between dentists and the corporation.
‚Ä¢ I am the type of partner that needs to pursue growth in order to be happy.

Hello, this is the list of luggage and sports equipment for my family trip
to Florida. I have rented a house until January 14th at Pompano Beach.
George Ferguson, a long-time family friend, has kindly volunteered to take
my truck and its cargo of personal items. I'm bringing the children's toys
from the sport equipment, some suitcases containing linen, accessories and
hygiene material, and also the electronic devices. I have taken the
initiative to create for you a non-exhaustive summary list of the cargo.
Here is the list: Two adult electric bikes 2 electric push bikes for
children Some bikes and children's scooters Kitesurfing equipment 5 sails 2
boards and foil bar Efoil electric board Paddleboard plus paddle All charg
ers for electronic equipment Remote controlled car 2 4-wheeled electric
vehicles for children Suitcase for 5 people including three children
Container with linen, accessories and standard hygiene material Car seat for
children
Bag with toys for children A laptop Life jackets Wet suits Tennis racket and
balls Pump to pump tires Folding camping chairs Protection blanket to not
damage the equipment Straps to secure the equipment Our intention is to have
the sprinter returned after our trip with exactly the same cargo as these
are items we regularly use. If you have any questions you can reach me at 4
5 0 5 6 7 0 5 1 4 C√©dric Leboeuf
